intro: Trochantha preussii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant features velvety, waxy leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of violet, pink, and white. Trochantha preussii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
